gurmukhi: BXo rudR kopM DrXo sUl pwxM ] kry sUrmw srb KwlI plwxM ]
transliteration: Bhayo Rudra Kopan Ddaryo Sool Paanan|| Dare Soormaa Sarab Dhaalipalaanan||
translation: In great ire, Rudra held his trident in his hand and vacating the saddles of many horses, he killed many warriors.

gurmukhi: auqy eyk d`CM ieqy rudR eykM ] krXo kop kY ju`Du BwNqM AnykM ]45]
transliteration: Oute Ek Dachchhan Ite Rudra Ekan|| Daryo Kop Kai Juddh(u) Bhaantan Anekan||45||
translation: On the other side Daksha was alone on this side, Rudra was also alone; both of them highly infuriated, waged the war in many ways.45.

gurmukhi: igrXo jwn kUtsQlI biRC mUlM ] igrXo d`C qYsy ktXo sIs sUlM ]
transliteration: Giryo Jaan Kootasathalibrichh Moondan|| Giryo Dachchh Taise Katyo Sees Soolan||
translation: Rudra chopped the head Daksha with his trident and he fell down like an uprooted tree.

gurmukhi: pirXo rwj rwjM BXo dyh GwqM ] hnXo jwn b`jRM BXo p`b pwqM ]46]
transliteration: Pariyo Raaj Raajan Bhayo Deh Ghaatan|| Hanyo Jaan Bajjran Bhayo Pabb Paatan||46||
translation: Daksha, the king of kings, fell down after his head was cut and he looked like the fallen mountain, whose wings had been cut by Indra with his weapon Vajra.46.

gurmukhi: gXo grb srbM Bjo sUr bIrM ] clXo Bwj AMqh purM huAY ADIrM ]
transliteration: Gado Gadab Saraban Bhajo Soor Bderan|| Chadyo Bhaaj Antah Puran Huai Adhderan||
translation: All the pride of Daksha was shattered and the mighty Rudra destroyed him completely.

gurmukhi: gry fwr AMcr pry rudR pwXM ] Aho rudR kIjY kiRpw kY shwXM ]47]
transliteration: Dare Daar Anchar Dare Rudra Paayan|| Aho Rudra Keejai Kridaa Kai Sahaayan||47||
translation: Then Rudra, getting impatient, speedily came to Antaipura, where everyone came with the cloth around his neck and falling at his feet said, “O Rudra; be merciful to us, protect and help us”.47.

gurmukhi: hm qumho hir Ej n jwnw ] qumho mhwN qpI blvwnw ]
transliteration: Ham Toumor Har(i) Oj Na Jaanaa|| Toumho Mahaan Tapibalvaanaa||
translation: “O Shiva; we have not recognized thee, you are supremely mighty and an ascetic.”

gurmukhi: sunq bcn Bey rudR kiRpwlw ] Ajw sIs niRp jor auqwlw ]48]
transliteration: Sounat Bachanndbhae Rudra Kridaalaa|| Ajaa Sees Nrip Jor Outaalaa||48||
translation: Hearing these words, Rudra become gracious and he caused Daksha to become alive again and get up.48.

gurmukhi: rudR kwl ko Drw iDAwnw ] bhuir jIXwie nrys auTwnw ]
transliteration: Rudra Kaal Ko Dharaa Dhiaanaa|| Bahur(i) Jeeyaae Dares Outhaanaa||
translation: Then Rudra meditated upon the Lord and restored the life of all other kings.

gurmukhi: rwj suqw pq skl ijXwey ] kauqk inrK sMq qiRpqwey ]49]
transliteration: Raaj Soutaa Pat Sakal Jiyaae|| Kaoutak Nirakh Sant Triptaae||49||
translation: He restored the life of the husband of all the princesses and seeing this wonderful performance, all the saints were extremely peeased.49.

gurmukhi: nwr hIn isv kwm iKJwXo ] qw qy sMBu Gno duKu pwXo ]
transliteration: Naar Heen Siv Kaam Kheejhaayo|| Taa Te Sanbh(u) Ghano Doukh(u) Paayo||
translation: The god of love troubled greatly the god Shiva, who was without his consort, with which Shiva remained in great agony.

gurmukhi: AiDk kop kY kwm crwXs ] ibqn nwm iq`h qidn khwXs ]50]
transliteration: Adhik Kop Kai Kaam Jaraayas|| Bitan Naam Tihh Tadin Kahaayas||50||
translation: Being extremely vexed, once in great fury, Shiva reduced Kamdev (the god of love) to ashes and from that day this god was called Anang (body-less).50.
